title: Smart contract standard

title: Owner initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the smart contract owner.
whitepaper: The owner of the smart contract is initialized in the constructor, where a non-zero owner address is required as an argument. Upon successful construction, the `OwnerChanged` event is emitted with the owner set to the provided address.
code: The owner of the smart contract is initialized in the constructor of the `Owned` contract, where the `_owner` parameter is passed to the constructor and set as the `owner` of the contract, provided that the `_owner` address is not the zero address. An `OwnerChanged` event is emitted to record the change of ownership from the zero address to the new owner.

title: Minter initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the token Minter.
whitepaper: The minter of the token is initialized by requiring that the address designated as `_minter` is already set as a minter in the `minters` mapping, as indicated by the `require(minters[_minter], "not a minter");` statement. This implies that the address must have been previously granted minter privileges before it can execute certain functions.
code: The minter of the token is initialized by calling the `_mint` function with the `creator_address` and `genesis_supply` as arguments. This occurs during the contract's deployment or initialization phase, granting the initial supply of tokens to the creator's address.
